eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.align

Enum HCPHorizontalAlignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HCPHorizontalAlignment>
      • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.align.HCPHorizontalAlignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<HCPHorizontalAlignment>

    public enum HCPHorizontalAlignment
extends Enum<HCPHorizontalAlignment>
    Alignment on the x-axis (which points to the right).

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CENTER
      The center x-coordinates will be aligned.
      LEFT
      The left (smaller) x-coordinates will be aligned.
      RIGHT
      The right (larger) x-coordinates will be aligned.

      • align

        public float align(float width,
                   float leftX,
                   float rightX)
        Aligns a segment of the specified width inside the segment specified by the leftX and rightX coordinates.

        The leftX argument should define the smaller and the rightX argument the larger x-coordinate of the parent segment. The width argument should define the length of the child segment (which should be positive).

        Note that, if the child segment is larger than the parent segment, although correctly aligned, some part(s) of it will be outside of the parent segment. If this is undesired behavior, a size check should be performed before calling this method.

        If the arguments do not satisfy the given constraints the return value of this method is unspecified. Otherwise, it returns the left (the smaller) x-coordinate of the aligned segment based on the origin of leftX and rightX.

        Parameters:
        width - should be >= 0
        leftX - should be <= rightX
        rightX - should be >= leftX
        Returns:
        the left x-coordinate of the aligned segment

      • alignWithParent

        public float alignWithParent(float width,
                             PDRectangle parent)
        Aligns a segment of the specified width inside the parent PDRectangle.

        The width of the parent rectangle and the width argument should be positive.

        Note that, if the child segment is wider than the parent rectangle, although correctly aligned, some part(s) of it will be outside of the parent rectangle. If this is undesired behavior, a size check should be performed before calling this method.

        If the arguments do not satisfy the given constraints the return value of this method is unspecified. Otherwise, it returns the left (the smaller) x-coordinate of the aligned segment based on the origin of the parent rectangle.

        Parameters:
        width - should be >= 0
        parent - not null and getWidth() should be >= 0
        Returns:
        the left x-coordinate of the aligned segment
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parent is null

      • alignChildWithParent

        public void alignChildWithParent(PDRectangle child,
                                 PDRectangle parent)
        Aligns the child PDRectangle inside the parent PDRectangle.

        The width of both rectangles should be positive.

        Note that, if the child is wider than the parent, although correctly aligned, some part(s) of it will be outside of the parent. If this is undesired behavior, a size check should be performed before calling this method.

        If the arguments do not satisfy the given constraints the x-coordinates of the child after this method returns are unspecified. Otherwise, the child will be horizontally aligned with the parent and its y-coordinates will be unmodified.

        Parameters:
        child - not null and getWidth() should be >= 0
        parent - not null and getWidth() should be >= 0
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if shape or parent is null
